title: Database Design and SQL Fundamentals
introduction: Databases are essential for storing and managing large amounts of data in an organized and efficient manner. SQL (Structured Query Language) is a standard language used to interact with relational databases.
details: Learning database design involves understanding concepts like tables, relationships, and normalization. SQL fundamentals include querying data using SELECT statements, modifying data with INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE statements, and creating database structures using DDL (Data Definition Language) statements.
